title: TOP 10 HIDDEN GEMS IN YOUR TRACTOR MANUAL!

subtasks: Check front tire rolling direction and align directional arrows forward
Reverse lug direction on tires for loader operations if mainly used for loader tasks
Adjust rear wheel positions using bolt plates for stability and lateral width up to 75 inches
Use proper loader bucket positions when leveling in reverse (less than 40 degrees below level) to avoid damage
Back out of mired conditions instead of driving forward to prevent tipping
Unhook towed implements and dig/mound support if stuck
Lower ROPS (Roll Over Protection Structure) when passing through low-clearance areas but always use seatbelt when upright
Close fuel shutoff valve during trailer transport
Flush coolant every 6,000 hours or six years for extended service intervals
Properly seat the engine speed for PTO engagement (1500 RPM or less or maximum for specific models)
Use grease lube shuttle for easier and mess-free grease application
Review and follow specific manual procedures for tasks like ballast weight and liquid ballast placement
Adopt float mode and proper elevation when using the loader to prevent edge bending and damage
